MajorClaims.MC1: schools and adults should put a sense of cooperation in children to make them becoming a useful adult whether in society or community

Claims.C1: competitive child would have more motivation and perspective that leads them to success
Claims.C2: A strong competition sense helps children having urge to learn or to practice for being the best among peers, and this factor is initially arises from the schools and parents, to encourage children to get the highest scores through the grading system
Claims.C3: cooperation is also an essential quality for children, no matter in school activities or in communities

Premises.P1: it would not help them much once they enter to society or company which required more about skill of team work
Premises.P2: it might be hard for a competitive person to deal or manage in a team work project
Premises.P3: a competitive child is usually more motivated to pursue a goal or to face difficulties independently
Premises.P4: it is also risky that children are becoming too competitive to cooperating with others
Premises.P5: Being competitive leads them to success, but could also restrict them in many ways
Premises.P6: Having a good cooperating spirit helps kids to communicate and get along with others, which gives them more possibility to solve problems or to achieve a goal easily by working as a team
Premises.P7: in society, there is hardly anyone who could has big achievement by oneself
Premises.P8: famous singers or movie stars, despite of their talent to make them successful, there are always a team to manage works or deal with things
